intro: Solanum insidiosum, commonly known as the deadly nightshade, is a toxic plant belonging to the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is native to parts of South America and is characterized by its dark purple berries and yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including atropine and scopolamine, which can be highly poisonous to humans and animals. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands and gardens. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care and avoid ingestion.
